other.description: At the end of your opponent’s turn, if this unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, you can remove this unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.
other.name: Skyleap

datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: brace of pistols; Corsair firearm; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Corsair Skyreaver Band
wargear: Any number of models can each have their Corsair firearm replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 shardcarbine ◦ 1 shuriken catapult ◦ 1 spar-glaive

For every 5 models in this unit, 1 model’s Corsair firearm can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 Aeldari missile launcher* ◦ 1 blaster* ◦ 1 dark lance ◦ 1 flamer ◦ 1 fusion gun ◦ 1 shredder* ◦ 1 shuriken cannon ◦ 1 splinter cannon
The Corsair Skyreaver Felarch can be equipped with one of the following: ◦ 1 dissonance pistol ◦ 1 void sabre * The profile for this weapon can be found on the Aeldari Legends Armoury card.

other.description: If your army includes this model, after both players have deployed their armies and determined who has the first turn, you can select one Rangers or Shroud Runners unit from your army and redeploy that unit. When doing so, that unit can be placed into Strategic Reserves, regardless of how many units are already in Strategic Reserves.
other.name: The Path Least Travelled

other.description: Once per turn, when an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move within 9" of this model, if this model is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, it can make a Normal move of up to D6".
other.name: Path of the Outcast

datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: ranger long rifle; power blade.
datasheets.name: Amallyn Shadowguide
wargear: None

other.description: In your Command phase, you can select one friendly Wraith Construct or Aeldari Vehicle model within 3" of this model. That Wraith Construct or Aeldari Vehicle model regains up to D3 lost wounds.
other.name: Psytronome Shaper

other.description: While this model is leading a unit, Wraith Construct models in that unit have the Feel No Pain 6+ ability.
other.name: Way of the Shaper (Psychic)

other.description: While this model is within 3" of one or more friendly Wraith Construct or Aeldari Vehicle units, unless it is leading a unit, this model has the Lone Operative ability.
other.name: Bonesinger

datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ Wraithblades ■ Wraithguard ■ Wraithlord
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: psytronome shaper.
datasheets.name: Bonesinger
wargear: None

other.description: You can target this unit with the Heroic Intervention Stratagem for 0CP, and can do so even if you have already used that Stratagem on a different unit this phase.
other.name: Reckless Abandon

datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: brace of pistols; twin shuriken catapult; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Corsair Cloud Dancer Band
wargear: Any number of models can each have their twin shuriken catapult replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 dark lance ◦ 1 dissonance cannon ◦ 1 scatter laser ◦ 1 shuriken cannon ◦ 1 splinter cannon
The Cloud Dancer Felarch can be equipped with one of the following: ◦ 1 dissonance pistol ◦ 1 void sabre

other.description: Once per turn, when an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move within 9" of this unit, if this unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, it can make a Normal move of up to D6".
other.name: Reaver Band

datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: brace of pistols; Corsair firearm; close combat weapon. CORSAIRS If a model from your army with the Leader ability can be attached to a Corsair Voidreavers unit, it can be attached to this unit instead.
datasheets.name: Corsair Reaver Band
wargear: Any number of models can each have their Corsair firearm replaced with 1 spar-glaive.

For every 5 models in this unit, 1 model’s Corsair firearm can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 Aeldari missile launcher* ◦ 1 blaster ◦ 1 dark lance ◦ 1 flamer ◦ 1 fusion gun ◦ 1 shredder ◦ 1 shuriken cannon ◦ 1 splinter cannon
The Corsair Reaver Felarch can be equipped with one of the following: ◦ 1 dissonance pistol ◦ 1 void sabre * The profile for this weapon can be found on the Aeldari Legends Armoury card.

enhancements.name: Firstdrawn Blade
enhancements.description: ASURYANI MOUNTED model only. Models in the bearer’s unit have the Scouts 9" ability.

enhancements.name: Phoenix Gem
enhancements.description: ASURYANI model only. The first time the bearer is destroyed, remove it from play, then, at the end of the phase, roll one D6: on a 2+, set the bearer back up on the battlefield as close as possible to where it was destroyed and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, with its full wounds remaining.

enhancements.name: Mirage Field
enhancements.description: ASURYANI MOUNTED model only. Each time an attack targets the bearer’s unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

enhancements.name: Seersight Strike
enhancements.description: ASURYANI MOUNTED PSYKER model only. Psychic weapons equipped by the bearer have the [ANTI‑MONSTER 2+] and [ANTI‑VEHICLE 2+] abilities.

enhancements.name: Echoes of Ulthanesh
enhancements.description: ASURYANI MOUNTED model only. In your Command phase, roll one D6, adding 1 to the result if the bearer is not within your deployment zone, and adding an additional 1 to the result if the bearer is within your opponent’s deployment zone: on a 5+, you gain 1CP.

enhancements.name: Guiding Presence
enhancements.description: AELDARI PSYKER model only. At the start of your Shooting phase, select one friendly AELDARI VEHICLE model within 9" of the bearer. Until the end of the phase, each time that model makes an attack, add 1 to the Hit roll.

enhancements.name: Light of Clarity
enhancements.description: SPIRITSEER model only. In your Command phase, select one friendly WRAITH CONSTRUCT unit within 12" of the bearer. Until the start of your next Command phase, add 1 to the Objective Control characteristic of INFANTRY models in that unit and add 3 to the Objective Control characteristic of MONSTER models in that unit.

enhancements.name: Stave of Kurnos
enhancements.description: SPIRITSEER model only. In your Command phase, select one friendly WRAITH CONSTRUCT unit within 12" of the bearer (excluding TITANIC units). Until the start of your next Command phase, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, on a Critical Wound, that attack has the [PRECISION] ability.

enhancements.name: Harmonisation Matrix
enhancements.description: AELDARI model only. In your Command phase, if the bearer (or any TRANSPORT it is embarked within) is within range of an objective marker you control, roll one D6: on a 3+, you gain 1CP.

enhancements.name: Rune of Mists
enhancements.description: SPIRITSEER model only. In your Command phase, select one friendly WRAITH CONSTRUCT unit within 12" of the bearer. Until the start of your next Command phase, each time a ranged attack targets that unit, unless the attacking model is within 18", models in that unit have the Benefit of Cover against that attack.

enhancements.name: Spirit Stone of Raelyth
enhancements.description: AELDARI PSYKER model only. While the bearer is within 3" of one or more friendly AELDARI VEHICLE units, the bearer has the Lone Operative ability. In your Command phase, you can select one friendly AELDARI VEHICLE model within 3" of the bearer. That model regains up to D3 lost wounds.

enhancements.name: Guileful Strategist
enhancements.description: AELDARI model only. If your army includes the bearer, after both players have deployed their armies, select up to three AELDARI VEHICLE units from your army and redeploy them. When doing so, any of those units can be placed into Strategic Reserves, regardless of how many units are already in Strategic Reserves.

enhancements.name: Higher Duty
enhancements.description: SPIRITSEER model only. Once per turn, when an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move within 9" of the bearer, the bearer’s unit can make a Normal move of up to 6".

enhancements.name: Cegorach’s Coil
enhancements.description: TROUPE MASTER model only. Each time the bearer’s unit ends a Charge move, select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of the bearer’s unit, then roll one D6 for each model in the bearer’s unit that is within Engagement Range of that enemy unit: for each 4+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound (to a maximum of 6 mortal wounds).

enhancements.name: Mask of Secrets
enhancements.description: HARLEQUINS model only. Each time an enemy unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) within Engagement Range of the bearer’s unit Falls Back, all models in that enemy unit must take a Desperate Escape test. When doing so, if that enemy unit is Battle‑shocked, subtract 1 from each of those tests.

enhancements.name: Murder’s Jest
enhancements.description: DEATH JESTER model only. Each time the bearer makes an attack that targets a unit that is Below Half‑strength, each successful Hit roll scores a Critical Hit.

enhancements.name: Mistweave
enhancements.description: SHADOWSEER model only. While the bearer is leading a unit, models in that unit have the Infiltrators ability.

enhancements.name: Timeless Strategist
enhancements.description: ASURYANI model only. At the start of the battle round, if the bearer is on the battlefield (or any TRANSPORT it is embarked within is on the battlefield), you receive 1 additional Battle Focus token.

enhancements.name: Gift of Foresight
enhancements.description: ASURYANI model only. Once per battle round, you can target the bearer’s unit with the Command Re‑roll Stratagem for 0CP.

enhancements.name: Psychic Destroyer
enhancements.description: ASURYANI PSYKER model only. Add 1 to the Damage characteristic of ranged Psychic weapons equipped by the bearer.

enhancements.name: Craftworld’s Champion
enhancements.description: ASURYANI model only. The bearer has an Objective Control characteristic of 5.

enhancements.name: Ethereal Pathway
enhancements.description: ASURYANI model only. In the Deploy Armies step, select up to two GUARDIANS units from your army. Models in the selected units have the Infiltrators ability.

enhancements.name: Protector of the Paths
enhancements.description: ASURYANI model only. While the bearer is leading a DIRE AVENGERS or GUARDIANS unit, once per battle round, you can target the bearer’s unit with the Fire Overwatch Stratagem for 0CP, and while resolving that Stratagem, hits are scored on unmodified Hit rolls of 5+, or unmodified Hit rolls of 4+ instead if the bearer’s unit is within range of an objective marker you control.

enhancements.name: Breath of Vaul
enhancements.description: ASURYANI model only. While the bearer is leading a STORM GUARDIANS unit, each time you roll to determine the number of attacks made with a flamer equipped by a model in that unit, you can re‑roll the result, and each time you make a Damage roll for a model equipped with a fusion gun in that unit, you can re‑roll the result.

enhancements.name: Gaze of Ynnead
enhancements.description: FARSEER model only. The bearer’s Eldritch Storm weapon has the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.

enhancements.name: Storm of Whispers
enhancements.description: WARLOCK model only. In your Shooting phase, after the bearer has shot, select one enemy unit hit by one or more of those attacks. That unit must take a Battle‑shock test.

enhancements.name: Borrowed Vigour
enhancements.description: ARCHON model only. Add 2 to the Attacks characteristic of the bearer’s melee weapons.

enhancements.name: Morbid Might
enhancements.description: SUCCUBUS model only. Each time the bearer makes a melee attack, you can re‑roll the Wound roll.

enhancements.name: Lucid Eye
enhancements.description: ASURYANI PSYKER model only. In your Command phase, you can add 1 to or subtract 1 from the value of one Fate dice in your Fate dice pool.

enhancements.name: Runes of Warding
enhancements.description: ASURYANI PSYKER model only. Models in the bearer’s unit have the Feel No Pain 4+ ability against mortal wounds, Psychic Attacks and Critical Wounds caused by attacks with the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.

enhancements.name: Stone of Eldritch Fury
enhancements.description: ASURYANI PSYKER model only. Add 12" to the Range characteristic of ranged Psychic weapons equipped by the bearer.

enhancements.name: Torc of Morai-Heg
enhancements.description: ASURYANI PSYKER model only. Once per turn, when your opponent targets a unit from their army within 12" of the bearer with a Stratagem, the bearer can use this Enhancement. If it does, increase the CP cost of that usage of that Stratagem by 1CP.

enhancements.name: Aspect of Murder
enhancements.description: AUTARCH or AUTARCH WAYLEAPER model only. Add 1 to the Damage characteristic of melee weapons equipped by the bearer, and those weapons have the [PRECISION] ability.

enhancements.name: Mantle of Wisdom
enhancements.description: AUTARCH or AUTARCH WAYLEAPER model only. While the bearer is leading an ASPECT WARRIORS unit, each time that unit is selected to shoot or fight, until the end of the phase, models in that unit gain both of the abilities from the Path of the Warrior Detachment rule.

enhancements.name: Shimmerstone
enhancements.description: AUTARCH or AUTARCH WAYLEAPER model only. While the bearer is leading an ASPECT WARRIORS unit, each time a ranged attack targets that unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

enhancements.name: Strategic Savant
enhancements.description: AUTARCH or AUTARCH WAYLEAPER model only. While the bearer is leading an ASPECT WARRIORS unit, add 1 to the Objective Control characteristic of models in that unit.

rule.text: If your Army Faction is **ASURYANI**, at the start of the battle round, you receive a number of Battle Focus tokens based on the battle size, as shown in the table below.

Each time one of the triggers shown in the Agile Manoeuvres section below occurs, you can spend one Battle Focus token to enable the relevant eligible unit to perform that Agile Manoeuvre. A unit is eligible to perform an Agile Manoeuvre if it has this ability and has not already performed an Agile Manoeuvre in the same phase. Unless otherwise stated, you cannot trigger the same Agile Manoeuvre more than once per phase. At the end of the battle round, all unspent Battle Focus tokens are lost.
Agile Manoeuvres

When mustering your army, you can include **HARLEQUINS** units in your army, even though they do not have the **ASURYANI** Faction keyword. Unless otherwise stated, you cannot select **HARLEQUINS** or **YNNARI** as your Army Faction.
Ranged weapons equipped by **AELDARI VEHICLE** models from your army have the **[ASSAULT]** ability and you can re‑roll Advance rolls made for **AELDARI VEHICLE FLY** units from your army.

Each time an **ASPECT WARRIORS** or **AVATAR OF KHAINE** unit from your army is selected to shoot or fight, select one of the following abilities for it to gain until the end of the phase:

■ Each time a model in this unit makes an attack, re‑roll a Hit roll of 1.
■ Each time a model in this unit makes an attack, re‑roll a Wound roll of 1.
You can use the following rules:
Lethal Intent

At the end of your opponent’s Shooting phase, if one or more **YNNARI** units from your army were destroyed this phase, select one **YNNARI** unit from your army (excluding **TITANIC** units). That unit can make a Normal move.
Lethal Surge

Once per turn, when a **YNNARI** unit from your army performs the Fade Back Agile Manoeuvre, it can make a Lethal Surge move instead of a Normal move. If it does, roll one D6 and add 1 to the result: that unit can be moved a number of inches up to the total. When doing so, those models can be moved within Engagement Range of the enemy unit that just triggered that Agile Manoeuvre.
Lethal Reprisal

At the start of the Fight phase, select one **YNNARI** unit from your army (excluding **TITANIC** units) that is below its Starting Strength. Until the end of the phase, that unit has the Fights First ability.
Each time a **HARLEQUINS** model from your army makes a Charge move, it can move through enemy models.

Each time a **DIRE AVENGER, GUARDIAN, SUPPORT WEAPON** or **WAR WALKER** model from your army makes an attack, if that model’s unit and/or the target unit are within range of one or more objective markers, add 1 to the Hit roll.
At the start of the first battle round, you generate Fate dice by rolling a number of D6 based on the battle size, as shown below. Keep your Fate dice to one side – this is your Fate dice pool.

Each time you use one of the Stratagems opposite, if your Fate dice pool contains one or more Fate dice showing the corresponding value in the table below, you can discard one of those corresponding Fate dice. If you do, reduce the CP cost of that usage of that Stratagem by 1CP.

Each time an **ASURYANI PSYKER** model from your army is destroyed by an enemy unit, that enemy unit gains a Vengeful Dead token. Each time a **WRAITH CONSTRUCT** model from your army makes an attack that targets a unit with one or more Vengeful Dead tokens, add 1 to the Hit roll and add 1 to the Wound roll.

**ASURYANI PSYKER** models from your army have the following ability:

**Spirit Guides (Aura):** While a **WRAITHBLADES**, **WRAITHGUARD** or **WRAITHLORD** unit from your army is within 12" of this model, that unit has the Battle Focus ability.

■ At the start of the battle round, you receive 1 additional Battle Focus token.
■ Each time a unit from your army performs the Swift as the Wind Agile Manoeuvre, until the end of the phase, add an additional 1" to the Move characteristic of models in that unit.
■ Each time a unit from your army performs an Agile Manoeuvre that involves rolling a D6, add 1 to the result.

In the Declare Battle Formations step you can set up **ASURYANI MOUNTED** and **VYPER** units from your army in Reserves. During the battle, such units can be set up on the battlefield as if they were arriving from Strategic Reserves. For the purposes of setting up **ASURYANI MOUNTED** or **VYPER** units from your army on the battlefield, treat the current battle round number as being one higher than it actually is.

In addition, at the end of your opponent’s turn, you can select a number of **ASURYANI MOUNTED** or **VYPER** units from your army (excluding units within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units), then remove those units from the battlefield and place them into Strategic Reserves. The maximum number of units you can select depends on the battle size, as shown below.

stratagems.name: Death From On High
stratagems.target: One ASURYANI MOUNTED or VYPER unit from your army that was set up on the battlefield from Reserves this turn and has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, you can re‑roll the Wound roll.
stratagems.fluff: Streaking suddenly down from on high, the Aeldari strike like the fall of an executioner’s blade.

stratagems.name: Focused Firepower
stratagems.target: One ASURYANI MOUNTED or VYPER unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
stratagems.fluff: Able to analyse and assess target data at incredible speeds, these Aeldari isolate the foe’s weak spot and pour all their fire into it as they hurtle past.

stratagems.name: Spiralling Evasion
stratagems.target: One ASURYANI MOUNTED or VYPER unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have a 4+ invulnerable save.
stratagems.fluff: None but the Aeldari could risk such breakneck and seemingly suicidal evasive manoeuvres to jink around incoming enemy fire.

stratagems.name: Crushing Strides
stratagems.target: That WRAITHBLADES, WRAITHLORD or WRAITHKNIGHT unit.
stratagems.when: Your Charge phase, just after a WRAITHBLADES, WRAITHLORD or WRAITHKNIGHT unit from your army ends a Charge move.
stratagems.effect: Select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of your unit and roll one D6 for each WRAITHBLADES model in your unit, or roll four D6 if your unit has the WRAITHLORD keyword, or roll six D6 if your unit has the WRAITHKNIGHT keyword: for each 3+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound.
stratagems.fluff: Elegant they may be, but the weight and implacable strength of wraith constructs on the charge can smash enemies to the ground bloody and broken.

stratagems.name: Seer’s Eye
stratagems.target: One AELDARI PSYKER model from your army and one friendly WRAITH CONSTRUCT unit within 12" of it that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Select one enemy unit visible to your PSYKER model. Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your WRAITH CONSTRUCT unit makes an attack that targets that enemy unit, you can ignore any or all modifiers to the Armour Penetration and/or Damage characteristics of that attack.
stratagems.fluff: Seeing their prey as much through the eyes of their guiding seer as with any sense of their own, the wraith constructs strike swift and true.

stratagems.name: Wraithbone Armour
stratagems.target: One WRAITH CONSTRUCT unit from your army (excluding TITANIC units) that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to a model in your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.
stratagems.fluff: The apparent fragility of wraith constructs’ lithe bodies belies their incredible resilience.

stratagems.name: Blades From Beyond
stratagems.target: One WRAITHBLADES, WRAITHLORD or WRAITHKNIGHT unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.
stratagems.fluff: Sometimes, the twinned perceptions of ghost warriors allow them to perceive – and strike at – the souls of their foes.

stratagems.name: Macabre Resilience
stratagems.target: One YNNARI INFANTRY or YNNARI MOUNTED unit from your army (excluding WRAITH CONSTRUCT units) that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.
stratagems.fluff: Such is the conviction and power of the Ynnari that sometimes even mortal wounds cannot slow them.

stratagems.name: Emissaries of Ynnead
stratagems.target: That YNNARI INFANTRY unit.
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after a YNNARI INFANTRY unit from your army has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, re‑roll a Hit roll of 1. If your unit is below its Starting Strength, you can re‑roll the Hit roll instead.
stratagems.fluff: Immersed in murder and gripped by holy purpose, these warriors bring Ynnead’s fatal message and his final gift to all who face them.

stratagems.name: Soulsight
stratagems.target: One YNNARI unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [LETHAL HITS] and [IGNORES COVER] abilities
stratagems.fluff: Perceiving the flickering soulstuff of their foes, the Ynnari strike with ruthless precision.

stratagems.name: Warding Salvoes
stratagems.target: One DIRE AVENGERS or GUARDIANS unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets an enemy unit within range of one or more objective markers, you can re‑roll the Wound roll.
stratagems.fluff: Woe betide the foe that seeks to claim the holdings of armed and determined Asuryani.

stratagems.name: Shield Nodes
stratagems.target: One DIRE AVENGERS or GUARDIANS unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: If your unit is within range of one or more objective markers, until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.
stratagems.fluff: Exploiting a spar of old Aeldari technology, these warriors engage the flickering ghosts of ancient defensive force fields.

stratagems.name: Vaul’s Vengeance
stratagems.target: One WAR WALKERS unit from your army.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit destroys a DIRE AVENGERS or GUARDIANS unit from your army
stratagems.effect: After that enemy unit has finished making its attacks, your unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, but when resolving those attacks, it can only target that enemy unit (and only if it is an eligible target).
stratagems.restrictions: You can only use this Stratagem once per battle round.
stratagems.fluff: Swift and terrible vengeance comes for those who dare strike down the warriors of the Aeldari in the form of searing heavy weapons fire.

stratagems.name: Blades of Asuryan
stratagems.target: One Dire AVENGERS or GUARDIANS unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [PISTOL] ability.
stratagems.fluff: Asuryani martial teachings enable those wielding ranged weapons to employ them as close‑quarter implements of death as well.

stratagems.name: Fate Inescapable
stratagems.target: One ASURYANI INFANTRY unit from your army (excluding WRAITH CONSTRUCT units) that has not been selected to shoot this phase and is within 9" of one or more friendly ASURYANI PSYKER models.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [IGNORES COVER] ability and each time a model in your unit makes an attack, on a Critical Wound, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
stratagems.fluff: The Aeldari have already seen how best to lay low this enemy and strike in the sure knowledge the foe cannot evade their terrible fate.

stratagems.name: Lightning-fast Reactions
stratagems.target: One ASURYANI unit from your army (excluding WRAITH CONSTRUCT units) that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
stratagems.fluff: Processing events at incredible speed, these warriors easily evade attacks that would have slain any less celeritous combatants.

stratagems.name: Blitzing Firepower
stratagems.target: One ASURYANI unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability while targeting an enemy unit within 12". If such a weapon already has that ability, until the end of the phase, each time an attack is made with that weapon, an unmodified Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.
stratagems.fluff: When unleashed in a close‑ranged storm, Aeldari weapons fire can completely eradicate all life within the target zone.

stratagems.name: Warrior Focus
stratagems.target: One ASPECT WARRIORS or AVATAR OF KHAINE unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, you can ignore any or all modifiers to that attack’s Ballistic Skill, Weapon skill, Strength, Armour Penetration and Damage characteristics and/or any or all modifiers to the Hit roll.
stratagems.fluff: So absolute is the focus of these warriors in battle that nothing can distract them or stay their blows.

stratagems.name: Doom Inescapable
stratagems.target: One AVATAR OF KHAINE model from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, your model’s Wailing Doom ranged weapon has a Range characteristic of 18" and a Damage characteristic of 8.
stratagems.fluff: Cast with the force of a thunderbolt, the Avatar’s weapon strikes the foe with meteoric force.

stratagems.name: Preternatural Precision
stratagems.target: One ASPECT WARRIORS unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Each time you use this Stratagem, you can remove one Aspect Shrine token your unit has (see datasheets). Then, select one of the following abilities, or select two of the following abilities if you removed an Aspect Shrine token during this usage of this Stratagem: [IGNORES COVER], [LETHAL HITS], [SUSTAINED HITS 1]. Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the selected abilities.
stratagems.fluff: Analysing their targets’ weaknesses with incredible skill, the Aeldari fire for lethal effect.

stratagems.name: Isha’s Fury
stratagems.target: One ASURYANI PSYKER model from your army within 9" of that enemy unit.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
stratagems.effect: Roll six D6: for each 3+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound.
stratagems.fluff: Leaping from the seer’s outstretched hand, this blast of empyric energy is a raw expression of the sorrow and bitterness suffered by the Aeldari people.

stratagems.name: Staged Death
stratagems.target: One HARLEQUINS CHARACTER model from your army that was just destroyed. You can use this Stratagem on that model even though it was just destroyed.
stratagems.when: Any phase.
stratagems.effect: At the end of the phase, set your model back up on the battlefield as close as possible to where it was destroyed and not within Engagement Range of any enemy units, with half of its starting number of wounds remaining.
stratagems.restrictions: Each model can only be targeted with this Stratagem once per battle.
stratagems.fluff: A feigned death and sudden, shocking return are as impactful as dismaying to the foe.

stratagems.name: Heroes’ Fall
stratagems.target: One HARLEQUINS unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6. On a 4+, do not remove the destroyed model from play; it can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.
stratagems.fluff: Though they may be slain, this step of the saedath calls on the players to act out the demise of tragic heroes who take their enemies with them to death.

stratagems.name: Mocking Flight
stratagems.target: That HARLEQUINS unit.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase, just after a HARLEQUINS unit from your army Falls Back.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.
stratagems.fluff: The Harlequins tumble away in mock terror and panic before spinning back into the fight with cruel laughter and redoubled fury.

stratagems.name: Tricksters’ Retort
stratagems.target: One TROUPE unit from your army that is within 9" of that enemy unit.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to 6".
stratagems.fluff: To the Harlequins, the foe are simply unwitting dance partners, their every move matched with graceful aplomb.

stratagems.name: Bloody Dance
stratagems.target: One HARLEQUINS INFANTRY or HARLEQUINS MOUNTED unit from your army that is within 6" of one or more enemy units and would be eligible to declare a charge against one or more of those enemy units if it were your Charge phase.
stratagems.when: End of your opponent’s Charge phase.
stratagems.effect: Your unit now declares a charge that only targets one or more of those enemy units, and you resolve that charge.
stratagems.restrictions: Note that even if this charge is successful, your unit does not receive any Charge bonus this turn.
stratagems.fluff: Enemies goaded into following the steps of the saedath come unwittingly on cue to their executions.

stratagems.name: Exit the Stage
stratagems.target: One HARLEQUINS unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
stratagems.when: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.
stratagems.fluff: Players know when to fade back from the stage of war, ready to strike again when their moment comes.

stratagems.name: Overflight
stratagems.target: One ASURYANI MOUNTED unit from your army that destroyed one or more enemy units this phase.
stratagems.when: End of your Shooting phase or the end of the Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to 7".
stratagems.fluff: These airborne warriors arc up and away from the ruin of their foes, already seeking fresh prey.

stratagems.name: Wind of Blades
stratagems.target: One ASURYANI MOUNTED or VYPER unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced or Fell Back.
stratagems.fluff: Warriors such as these cannot be pinned down or held back. They hit and run at will, hammering the foe with constant fire and slashing blows.

stratagems.name: Daring Riders
stratagems.target: One ASURYANI MOUNTED or VYPER unit from your army in Reserves.
stratagems.when: The Reinforcements step of your Movement phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, when setting up your unit on the battlefield from Reserves, it can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy units. When doing so, if your unit is set up within 9" horizontally of one or more enemy units, until the end of the turn, it is not eligible to declare a charge.
stratagems.fluff: Some of the Windrider Hosts are especially aggressive, unable to restrain the fierce joy of racing perilously close to the foe while strafing them with fire.

stratagems.name: Soul Bridge
stratagems.target: One WRAITHBLADES, WRAITHGUARD or WRAITHLORD unit from your army and one ASURYANI PSYKER model from your army.
stratagems.when: Your Command phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the start of your next Command phase, your WRAITHBLADES, WRAITHGUARD or WRAITHLORD unit is considered to be within 12" of your PSYKER model for the purposes of the Psychic Guidance and Spirit Guides abilities.
stratagems.fluff: It is risky for a Spiritseer to cast their awareness so far, but aiding the dead is sometimes necessary.

stratagems.name: Spirit Token
stratagems.target: One WRAITHBLADES or WRAITHGUARD unit from your army.
stratagems.when: Start of your Movement phase.
stratagems.effect: Select one objective marker you control that your unit is within range of. That objective marker remains under your control until your opponent’s Level of Control over that objective marker is greater than yours at the end of a phase.
stratagems.fluff: By leaving psycho‑resonant wraithbone markers upon the battlefield, these warriors wreathe vital strategic locations in an aura of dread not easily overcome.

stratagems.name: Pall of Dread
stratagems.target: One YNNARI unit from your army that was just destroyed while it was within range of one or more objective markers you controlled at the end of the previous phase. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
stratagems.when: Any phase.
stratagems.effect: Select one of those objective markers. That objective marker remains under your control until your opponent’s Level of Control over that objective marker is greater than yours at the end of a phase.
stratagems.fluff: Even after they fall, the most fervent Ynnari leave a sinister sense of watchfulness in their wake like some invisible death shroud.

stratagems.name: Death Answers Death
stratagems.target: One YNNARI unit from your army (excluding WRAITH CONSTRUCT units), if one or more models in that unit were destroyed this phase.
stratagems.when: End of your opponent’s Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase.
stratagems.fluff: As the foe slays their warriors, a terrible vigour grips the Ynnari and compels them to repay the slaughter in kind.

stratagems.name: Time to Strike
stratagems.target: One STORM GUARDIANS unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in your unit. Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced.
stratagems.fluff: Storm Guardians train to recognise where and when their selfless aggression can best benefit their craftworld and never to miss such opportunities.

stratagems.name: Cost of Victory
stratagems.target: One GUARDIANS unit from your army.
stratagems.when: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: If your unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, remove it from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves. When doing so, return every destroyed GUARDIANS model to your unit.
stratagems.fluff: In so desperate and vital a fight, the Aeldari must accept casualties they would normally avoid and even send fresh warriors in to bolster the flagging ranks if it means victory.

stratagems.name: Cloudstrike
stratagems.target: One AELDARI VEHICLE unit from your army that can FLY and is in Strategic Reserves.
stratagems.when: Start of the Reinforcements step of your Movement phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, your unit has the Deep Strike ability. When your unit is set up on the battlefield using the Deep Strike ability, it can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy units, but if it does, until the end of the turn, it is not eligible to declare a charge. In addition, if your unit is a TRANSPORT, each unit that disembarks from it this turn must be set up more than 6" horizontally from all enemy units and until the end of the turn, is not eligible to declare a charge.&x20;
stratagems.fluff: The Asuryani often deploy their anti‑grav vehicles in the lower atmosphere rather than on the ground. At a signal, they strike before the enemy can react.

stratagems.name: Soulsight
stratagems.target: One AELDARI VEHICLE unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit is selected to shoot, you can re‑roll one Hit roll, one Wound roll and one Damage roll made for a model in your unit. If you are using fast dice rolling, you can select one of those rolls to re‑roll before moving onto the next step of the attack sequence.
stratagems.fluff: Spirit stones containing the souls of gifted seers have been embedded into this vehicle’s targeting matrices. The essences within lend guidance even in death.

stratagems.name: Anti-grav Repulsion
stratagems.target: One AELDARI VEHICLE unit from your army that can FLY and was selected as a target of that charge.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Charge phase, just after an enemy unit has declared a charge.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, subtract 2 from Charge rolls made for that enemy unit.
stratagems.fluff: Skilled Aeldari pilots angle their vehicle’s anti‑grav fields to repulse the enemy.

stratagems.name: Layered Wards
stratagems.target: That AELDARI VEHICLE unit.
stratagems.when: Any phase, just after a mortal wound is allocated to an AELDARI VEHICLE unit from your army.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability against mortal wounds.
stratagems.fluff: The wraithbone superstructure of this vehicle has been interlaced with warding runes, enabling its hull to resist incoming fire.

stratagems.name: Swift Deployment
stratagems.target: One AELDARI TRANSPORT unit from your army.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, units can disembark from your TRANSPORT after it has Advanced. Units that do so count as having made a Normal move that phase, and cannot declare a charge in the same turn, but can otherwise act normally.
stratagems.fluff: With consummate skill, Guardian crews guide their agile armoured transports across the battlefield before swooping low to unload their cargo of warriors.

stratagems.name: Vectored Engines
stratagems.target: That AELDARI VEHICLE unit.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase, just after an AELDARI VEHICLE unit from your army that can FLY Falls Back.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Fell Back.
stratagems.fluff: The result of exquisite and ingenious Aeldari engineering, vectored engines enable grav vehicles to evade their enemies while maintaining accurate fire.

stratagems.name: Presentiment of Dread
stratagems.target: One ASURYANI PSYKER model from your army.
stratagems.when: Command phase.
stratagems.effect: Select one enemy unit within 18" of and visible to your model. That enemy unit must take a Battle‑shock test, subtracting 1 from that test.
stratagems.fluff: The seer plucks fate to find the foe suffering a horrible death, then projects it into their minds.

stratagems.name: Forewarned
stratagems.target: One ASURYANI INFANTRY unit from your army (excluding WRAITH CONSTRUCT units) that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks and is within 9" of one or more friendly ASURYANI PSYKER models.
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll and subtract 1 from the Wound roll.
stratagems.fluff: Having foreseen already how this fight will play out, the seer projects their insights and warnings into the minds of the Aeldari who must fight it.

stratagems.name: Unshrouded Truth
stratagems.target: One ASURYANI INFANTRY unit from your army (excluding WRAITH CONSTRUCT units) that has not been selected to move this phase, was not set up on the battlefield this phase, and is within 9" of one or more friendly ASURYANI PSYKER models.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase.
stratagems.effect: Remove your unit from the battlefield and set it up again anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy models.
stratagems.restrictions: Until the end of the phase, your unit is not eligible to be selected to move.
stratagems.fluff: Dispelling the psychosomatic mirage that has so far beguiled and assailed the foe, the seer reveals the true location of the warriors it was masquerading as.

stratagems.name: Psychic Shield
stratagems.target: One ASURYANI INFANTRY unit from your army (excluding WRAITH CONSTRUCT units) that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks and is within 9" of one or more friendly ASURYANI PSYKER models.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, your unit can only be selected as the target of a ranged attack if the attacking model is within 18".
stratagems.fluff: A twist of the seer’s psychic powers raises a whirling shield of empyric energy and psychokinetic debris to screen the Aeldari from enemy fire.

stratagems.name: Skyborne Sanctuary
stratagems.target: One ASURYANI unit from your army and one friendly TRANSPORT it is able to embark within.
stratagems.when: End of the Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: If your ASURYANI unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units and is wholly within 6" of that TRANSPORT, it can embark within it.
stratagems.fluff: The Aeldari excel in striking swiftly, then leaping back into the safety of their skimming transports.

stratagems.name: Feigned Retreat
stratagems.target: That ASURYANI unit.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase, just after an ASURYANI unit from your army Falls Back.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.
stratagems.fluff: What appears to be a full retreat one moment is revealed as the deceptive prelude to a devastating attack the next.

stratagems.name: Fire and Fade
stratagems.target: That ASURYANI unit.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase, just after an ASURYANI INFANTRY unit from your army (excluding AIRCRAFT, ASURMEN and WRAITH CONSTRUCT units) has shot.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to D6+1".
stratagems.restrictions: Until the end of the turn, your unit is not eligible to declare a charge.
stratagems.fluff: The Aeldari are masters of hit‑and‑run tactics, engaging a target with a flurry of shots before swiftly ducking back out of harm’s way.

stratagems.name: Webway Tunnel
stratagems.target: One ASURYANI INFANTRY unit from your army that is wholly within 9" of one or more battlefield edges.
stratagems.when: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: If your unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, remove it from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.
stratagems.fluff: By slipping away into the ethereal confines of the Webway, Aeldari warriors can circumnavigate the foe and strike from new and unexpected quarters.

stratagems.name: To Their Final Breath
stratagems.target: One ASPECT WARRIORS or AVATAR OF KHAINE unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Each time you use this Stratagem, you can remove one Aspect Shrine token your unit has (see datasheets). Then, until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6, adding 1 to the result if you removed an Aspect Shrine token during this usage of this Stratagem. On a 4+, do not remove the destroyed model from play; it can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.
stratagems.fluff: As champions and defenders of a dying race, these warriors fight furiously to the very end.

stratagems.name: Skyborne Sanctuary
stratagems.target: One ASURYANI unit from your army and one friendly TRANSPORT it is able to embark within.
stratagems.when: End of the Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: If your ASURYANI unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units and is wholly within 6" of that TRANSPORT, it can embark within it.
stratagems.fluff: The Aeldari excel in striking swiftly then leaping back into the safety of their skimming transports.

stratagems.name: Khaine’s Vengeance
stratagems.target: One ASPECT WARRIORS or AVATAR OF KHAINE unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of that enemy unit.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Movement phase, just after an enemy unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) is selected to Fall Back.
stratagems.effect: All models in that enemy unit must take a Desperate Escape test. When doing so, if that enemy unit is Battle‑shocked, subtract 1 from each of those tests.
stratagems.fluff: Embodying the rage of Khaine himself, these warriors press home their attack and strike down those cowards who seek to flee their fury.

stratagems.name: Parting the Veil
stratagems.target: One YNNARI unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.
stratagems.fluff: In the moment of transcendent glory, before the Ynnari give their essence to their god, they fight harder than ever to take the foe with them to death.
